page.title: 06PARISH CHURCH:ST MARYS
page.content: ===================================== The Parish Church of St. Mary the Virgin was built in 1626.A Norman archway and font still exist as part of the church's fabric,indicating that a church has existed on this site ince that period.Its construction is of red brick and flint,with a bell tower and surrounding churchyard.A modern extension has been added, completed in 1983; which offers public amenities,meeting hall,creche and vestry.The church has an electoral oll of 150 and holds three services a week.Celebrations of Christmas,Harvest Festival,St Mary's day and The Passover Supper are held anually.The average congregation is 50.
